OcsWmKuV3cvbhUiARxCT6w.text: The food and service was the best I've had in a very long time. I recommend Metro Dinner to anyone that needs to be saved.. Service was top dollar. My server was Stephen was by far the best. And the price was well worth every penny. I recommend the pulled pork Mac stack, Trust me!!!

d1xOQpd_RphG3tYr6d1IsQ.text: From start to finish...this is how you run a restaurant.   The Service - incredible! Gracious, kind and always willing to help. Knowledgable staff and always welcoming.   The food - off the CHARTS!!! - breakfast, one of my favorite spots in town. I usually get the special but haven't had anything I would feel bad recommending. The fried chicken is the best I have ever had...  From start to finish...the best spot in town!!!

PE5wDRj8U327cmDUNcjXxw.text: Service was great.  Nice atmosphere as a diner from the past.  I had the best chicken pot pie I have ever eaten for a late lunch today.

wWVE8w9avdtGjvtCEcxotQ.text: I will be missing this place as we move to another state, this place is a Diamond in a rough. Awesome food and they'll accommodate Vegan/Vegetarian eaters. Love the awesome service and their hot chocolate is better than any diners I've tried (not hot water and chocolate powder).  It's worth trying this place.

0GzuBp1uDQDo-Vl3SWLGFw.text: I have become quite the regular here over the past few months and not once have I been disappointed! From the food to the service, it's always great! No matter how busy it is the wait is never long for your food and the servers are always so nice and on top of things. Today we had Maggie and she was great! Being in the service industry there's nothing I appreciate more than seeing people who are happy to be at work and take pride in what they do. I'll definitely keep coming back!

op0rbT3X-D8pOa4uJtr-_w.text: Was looking forward to the chicken and waffles here, but the chicken was very so-so. Meat was a bit rubbery and skin was nothing special. The waffles were a saving grace - so soft and that strawberry butter, yum! Overall, one of the poorer chicken/waffles I've had. My wife had a breakfast sandwich that was simple - eggs, bacon, etc. but wow it was awesome! I'd give this place another chance, they've got a diverse menu, maybe I'll stick to the sandwiches. We went on a Sunday morning and it was packed, but they seat folks as best as they can. The hunt for great fried chicken in Vegas continues!

qhB2z1m6pZOi-A6o0Tpgiw.text: Corned beef hash was just ok. Everything else was great! We had the platter that had eggs, hash browns, bacon and pancakes... the perfect breakfast combo!

iA-z6sok1uQLtJj8qHtz6A.text: My Fiance and I have made this our local spot. We have never had a bad experience!!! We have had multiple amazing waitresses and every meal we have tried we have loved. The manager of this location is awesome and is always there with a friendly face to make sure our experience was as good as the last. If you haven't tried it yet you should!!

7VX0sGHxLNRMSr5CU0l4kg.text: Truly a very friendly and welcoming atmosphere, food was ok, I've had better for the prices but good quality service more then makes up for the few dollars you have to spend here or there. But it's a good place to stop for a bite to eat occasionally.

gwmbfYG8JbQVGGgF1EKydQ.text: THIS PLACE WAS THE BEST. I've never been to a place where I felt so at home. Food was delicious and fresh with huge portions, and our waitress Darla was phenomenal. Have been driving past this place for months now and I'm so glad I decided to go inside. Will be my go-to spot when it comes to food from now on!

OHP32XhETArHD9CxSJz8ag.text: Staff is very nice. Which is not easy to find in Vegas anymore.  Food was good and quick and hot. The customers are local and friendly. Seats are a little uncomfortable. Will go back for the fried chicken.

ywDJP6FaLMVE7E8E5Wv3mQ.text: Metro dinner is awesome! Great service and great food! I had the meat loaf and mashed potatoes. I don't really care for meat loaf but I think this was the best meat loaf I have ever had! Our servers name was Javier he was awesome! He was well knowledgeable on the menu and was on top of everything. Will definitely be back again!

nX2agX_OtGMy9NNFdvJ6zQ.text: Used to working at five star resorts, my roommate and I are trained to give (and spot) exceptional service, and that's exactly what we found at Metro Diner. Even the extremely reasonable 25 minute wait for Sunday brunch was enjoyable in their outdoor space equipped with complimentary coffee.  Gone is the faulty pen-and-pad method of yesteryear. The wait staff here are equipped with iPads that send orders directly to the kitchen. From our seats, we could see behind the counter where the kitchen operated like smooth, Swiss-engineered clockwork. Our food came out hot, fresh, and faster than we could have expected. I highly recommend the pound cake French Toast--but as dessert, rather than an entree!  The meal itself was sublime: delicious diner food, made with fresh ingredients and in generous portions. The service, however, is where Metro really shines. Though the restaurant was packed, we were greeted, seated, and fed in record time. Even our water glasses were kept magically full as if by wonderful, friendly diner fairies.  We've all been to restaurants where servers cater only to their designated sections, and felt ignored when we need help but nobody nearby was assigned to us. Not so at Metro Diner. Every employee who passed by our table here stopped to ask how we were doing, and seemed genuinely interested in the answer.  Metro Diner gives their employees the flexibility to take care of guests instead of following rigid, micromanaged procedures--which can feel insincere and inefficient. When the server dropping off our food realized we had made a sub (home fries instead of hash browns), she brought a replacement in under three minutes, without having to consult the server who took our order, get approval from a manager, or otherwise jump through hoops to make things right.  I don't have a single complaint. Metro Diner exceeded my expectations in every way. Bravo!

uQuPI0aTbsXdW0Po4G24dg.text: Seriously, why do people think this place is good?!?!  We've gone twice and both times it was crap.   The first time I had the meatloaf. I've never had meatloaf with that consistency. It was like baked dog food, only not as good.   Today we came for breakfast. I ordered the breakfast pie (their specialty), Mike had biscuits and gravy.   We waited 35 minutes (literally). When our food arrived it was obvious that Mike's food had been sitting. His eggs and hash browns were cold and there was a gross film over his biscuits and gravy.   I ordered bacon with mine, but I didn't get it. You'd think after waiting for so long they could've at least served me some improperly cooked bacon.   The manager came over with her bullshit apology. It was inauthentic and patronizing.   I've seen the reviews on Yelp, the owner's mother must have written them, because anyone who's ever been to a restaurant in Vegas could tell that this place sucks.

F6xrqSXBOq8zNxK1-8AoKA.text: Stopped here after a weekend in Vegas and could not be happier with the experience! All of the staff were welcoming and kind and seated us in a great booth. Our server Myriam was incredible! So attentive and sweet. She was able to handle all of our order changes and even went the extra mile to give us to-go coffees for our ride back! The food was delicious and very reasonably priced!  We all felt very satisfied with our meals.

MWPZe_nJoLsl4PExXsLRDg.text: A regular neighborhood Diner, with huge food portions. You will have a left over box to take home. Okay parking good service, friendly staff. If you like American Diner food this is your kind of place.  Since I cannot eat heap of food, or anything deep fried this is not my kind of restaurant. But if you are hungry and want a nice friendly place to sit and eat this is a good place.

JfyGUpi1rYf0kvyzFOsUCA.text: This was my first visit at the Metro Diner. My family had visited another location and was in love with the food, and environment.   My family and I arrived around 11am to have a brunch together. I was immediately surprised by the selections of food I had to choose from. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner all day long which was a huge plus for me. I'm not a big breakfast person so this place was off to a good start in my books.   I give this place 4 stars for the lack of service and bland taste. I ordered the Avocado Toast which may explain the bland taste but the service was missing. I absolutely loved the guy that served us but we were handed off a few times which made it confusing when we were trying to order with someone. When we did place our order another person would come up and ask what we wanted and we would have to explain that we already ordered with someone else. I loved the servers but it seemed a little unorganized.   Overall it was a pleasant visit for my family and I. I will be back to update my review to see if this day was just a one off.

BRBXsyoQ2VR9HCo_7aKZlg.text: I was visiting from Florida and saw that Metro Diner was here in Las Vegas. As always, the food was amazing! We ordered the meatloaf and pot roast. However one of the meatloaf dishes was a little on the cold side. They took it back as we asked them to warm it up. The manager J. J. Came out to ask about the problem and he informed us that they were making a fresh new plate of meatloaf and he was also comping the entree! That's great service!! Bravo for metro Diner for awesome service!

8mTJW1ugRISg_e_lgGfKhA.text: First time here, will definitely be back. This is a great place and very friendly staff Chicken and Waffles the Halal French toast everything very good. Darla will break it down for you great great service and lots of food for the price

lpwI-4xrR_CiXWXyPAVl-g.text: Finally stopped & tried this place last night. My family & I really enjoyed it! Decently priced & big portion plates. Everything is homemade which makes it some nice comfort food. It was pretty crowded but we were greeted & seated right away. Friendly staff & our server was knowledgeable about the menu & attentive. I definitely want to come back & explore the menu more. So many options & variety!

_hxLC2nCzV34lhfaoUoWmg.text: Came in for a late breakfast during mid-week.  Our waitress was great, food tasted like a marvelous home cooked comfort meal.  Portion sizes were good.  Will definitely go back.

yn9idcYJcMOonSAO1RWb4g.text: Very disappointed.  Went for first visit. Surprised at dirty bathroom .  Ordered the Monte Cristo it was all bread and greasy. Never asked how the food was.  Waiter gave us the bill before the first bite of food.  Probably would have tried desert had he not.  No intention of returning.

mQwx0q_qDMhAGaYRFpQp6w.text: WE LOVE DARLA !! Best service ever. Went here for the very first time on a little breakfast date with my dad. I'm a VERY picky eater on top of being a vegetarian so finding a place that we both agree on isn't always easy. Everything here was seriously amazing! Idk which was better, the food or the service. Metro Diner is definitely going to be our new regular place. Our server Darla was beyond perfect and I highly recommend her to everyone!!

mLX1FZ_VkEnYKh01u_69_g.text: Metro Diner is a great place to have breakfast. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that they don't offer a turkey bacon or sausage option. The portions are very large and the food is definitely good. They have call ahead seating as well! Call before so you aren't waiting for forever.   **update** I super appreciate the manager Tony reaching out and letting me know about the turkey options. I will definitely be going back to give it a try!

Fpg1lzE1b-jhth-1srs9dw.text: Corned beef hash is average. Silver dollar pancakes were rubbery. Waitstaff was really friendly but service was okay

NxkwAvED9pGfuX-tHUbCTg.text: Walked in place was inviting and clean. Waitress Kelly was an absolute sweetie after greating us in a timely manner. Food arrived quickly and was hot. All three entrees we ordered were delicious. My son had the special which consisted of a cornbread waffle, pulled pork, and mac and cheese. Sounds a little unorthodox, but it was to die for. Overall experience was an A+, we will be returning.

U7riwjbzMQ_qTU1kB7w4zA.text: I'm a huge fan of this diner. They have the friendliest service with a genuine diner feel to it. Every time I'm there, I forget that I'm in the Sin City but rather, at a small town where everyone knows each other.   The first time I visited, I got a burger with mac and cheese with it. Deliciously sinful filled with flavorful seasoning along with it. Along with that, the texture from all ingredients made it a delicious meal. At the same time, my girlfriend got the Philly Cheese Sandwich to which she was very happy about. The buns were just right with a generous amount of meat along with it. A must try.   The second time we visited, I got their famous meatloaf to which delivers in taste. Wow. I've never been a huge fan of such an entree but I've changed my mind. Along with its sides like the mashed potatoes and vegetables, it was an amazing meal over all. This is not and overstatement, you have to order their meatloaf. My girlfriend, on the other hand, got the hashed corned beef with a side of two poached eggs. Wow. Pair the two together and it heightens the entree. Definitely a must try as well.   My favorite from my visits there are their amazing cobblers. Topped with a classically-made ice cream and this dessert is the epitome of all sweets.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple cobbler
Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hashed with two poached eggs
Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf

EA5orqw6YAuxsAGl71N08A.text: Waffles are so good here the strawberry flavored butter is a good pairing for the waffles.  My girlfriend got the corned beef hash and it isn't the normal corned beef from the big can.  the corned beef was seasoned with coarse black pepper.  The nachos mmmmm mmmm.  I can't say what white cheese it was but the chips are nice and hot with chopped green onions, chicken, jalapeno.  Staff was nice, which you have to wait for a host to seat you and lunch is a busy time.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. corned beef hash with eggs Benedict , nachos, waffle with strawberry flavored butter.

kcGgwaW7EE--YORj_9UvPQ.text: Another great dinner at Metro Diner.  I had the fried chicken dinner. Wasn't an easy choice since the waffles are so good. The mashed potatoes and gravy and biscuit  were soooo delicious. I left with enough food for tomorrow too.  My husband had a burger and the next time I'm in a burger mood, I'm going there! He said it was very good.

XSJ7xe2t3p8PU8y-He3pww.text: Breakfast for dinner? Yes please!  Came in because I wanted fish & chips, so this was the nearest place to my house that served it. Totally fell for the CHICKEN AND WAFFLES. If you come here without trying the chicken waffles, did you really try Metro Diner? Lol! The chicken was so good and satisfying. The crunchy skin and the flavor was just all there. Plus, the strawberry butter went well with the meal. (Of course I asked for extra haha) Make sure they make their special sauce for any chicken dish, which is basically the syrup and Louisiana hot sauce mixed together.  The other dish we got was the SMOTHERED CHICKEN, which is on their daily special. It was okay (not as good as the chicken and waffles). It's chicken tenders smothered in melted cheese with some sauteed veggies.   The service: our server was so funny! & knowledgeable. I think his name was Philip. But he helped us with picking our order and he was so attentive   Overall, great experience. We'll be back again

UzujovDTtX19lBfCim7boQ.text: Darla was our server and I've never had that amazing of service ever. We just got into town last night from Kansas City and we were ready to start our sister's bday with a great breakfast.  Darla knew her menu and recommended the best food ever!! We have never had breakfast that good!! Darla is your most prized asset as Well as the most delicious food for an amazing price.  I will be back here regularly and to laugh with my most favorite person ever Darla. Thank you Darla we love you and you will be known and loved from Kansas city!! Thank you for the laughs

AfCgzhX2tZPeRaTNghypwA.text: My veggie omelette was ON POINT, but the coffee wasn't. Coffee at a diner should always be on pointz, but I guess coffee is a crapshoot. I miss the old east coast new Jersey diners. Metro isn't quite like those, but it's a diner nonetheless. If you want a variety of breakfast, lunch, dinner menu items that are pretty good and decently priced, Metro Diner isn't the worst place in the world to go.

ai6WiaFG8Q462_tZL62S9Q.text: A couple of days ago was the 2nd time I had walked in to order for take out and was ignored. Completely. Mind you, it was DEAD inside - just like me after leaving this place completely disappointed by the lack of customer service. I walk in, tell a host/hostess or waiter that I'd like to order for take out and then they disappear. For 10+ minutes. I don't understand. Where the F*&%$ do they go? This last time, I was about to walk out and the waiter finally comes out and says, "oh have you been helped already?" So I tell him why I'm upset and that it's the 2nd time this has happened to me. And I hate to be Karen who asks for the Manager - but he offered me the business card of the restaurant manager, it was sitting on the hostess podium stand. It's too bad, because I really love their food. I hope they get their s#!$ together

I4xNhSnt82TwBfqbmhg6Ow.text: I had a great time at brunch. Been here a few times before to get their yummy banana cream pie. This time we had the Spicy Honey Chicken Biscuit, the Metro Pancake, and the Fried Chicken & Waffle. Their fried chicken is honestly the best thing I've had here. It's perfectly crispy and mouthwatering both in the fried chicken and waffle and with the spicy chicken biscuit. I've had better biscuits and waffle elsewhere, but still pretty good. The strawberry sauce that comes with the waffle really compliments the whole dish. When it comes to the pancake, I was impressed by fluffiness and the size of it. If you're craving a big fluffy pancake, this is the place to go. This is a great local place to go if you're craving a hearty American breakfast.

IBX0Kdsf4_7UkW9bm0Y-9Q.text: We had Metro Diner cater a meeting at our office.  The food arrived hot and delicious.  The food was amazing, I really enjoyed the fruit, yogurt, and granola.    We were worried we might run out of food, but he was able to get us more food with a very quick turnaround time. Tony provided us with amazing service and I cannot wait to use them again.

z4g8zjqtP3ZFopZlm8iCqw.text: Quick, great service. We literally ordered and had out food withinn5 minutes. The Best chicken and waffles in Las Vegas! They are served with an mazing strawberry butter, and the waiter prepared our syrup with Louisiana hot sauce! Let me just say it was AMAZING!The coffee was also very good! I will definitely be visit this place again.

wmDBpJ5wi52UuAvcTz067A.text: Went to metro diner last week with family that was visiting from the midwest.  They wanted chicken and waffles and metro diner came through like a charm.  Seven very satisfied and full customers!!  The whole experience was great and our waitress was superb even with my dad demanding his coffee to be scolding hot.  Also thanks for taking photo for us!  Metro rocks!!

9xuKCgHIofGlyCNn_uIcaQ.text: Comfort food at its best! I've been to Metro Diner about a dozen times since it opened and it's become a regular in our dinner rotation.  The fried chicken is awesome and the best part is, I always have enough leftover for tomorrow (double bonus). But my favorite item has to be the meatloaf. I usually hate meatloaf - either it's dry, has too many spices, or tastes too "meaty." But this meatloaf is moist, seasoned well and filling! I initially only tried it because my husband ordered it and raved about it. Now it's one of my go-tos.  I've also had breakfast and lunch there - both of which were good, not great. So for me, dinner is where it's at. My only complaint is, there are no refills on their flavored iced tea :(  Service is always excellent, friendly staff and very accommodating!

xSS23rWgZzdeY6_G9GP_tw.text: Only been there once so far for their monte cristo sandwich. Those are hard to find made the way Bennigans used to. It was very similar but would have been much better if served when it was done and hot instead of luke warm with cold fries. It was a busy weekend morning so Ill try it again since it could very well just been our waitresses fault for not grabbing it in the window when ready. It was still really good and the other stuff like chicken and waffles looked good too.

Ha9QMea1Q37SD3SZxhrGFg.text: This was the best experience I ever had. I chose to be right up front to enjoy my food and the show these guys put on it's pretty cool to see your food made:) awesome place and if you get a chance to experience Metro Diner try their yummy chicken and waffles with there homemade strawberry butter or there to die for Meatloaf with grilled vegetables  go now !!!  Ps they also open early so go in for there hardy breakfast good way to start your day

BU2IInd2ljyGJtQNfpF_yw.text: Great service and excellent food. Cornbread soft and tasty. Chicken and waffles was my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixture or the cornbread and mac and cheese with pulled wad delicious. Portions are large.
Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle had a light and crispy batter.
Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food and excellent service.

LgaGO5M0at_SM7MOfCbZbQ.text: I live in Texas and have therefore eaten chicken and waffles countless times. Not something I would think to order in Vegas. I went for it given it was the most popular dish on the menu.  So glad I did! The chicken was cooked to perfection and waffles were light and fluffy, not too dense. Amazing strawberry butter with actual strawberries. This meal was made complete with pumpkin spice coffee.  So good.   Service was also on point - Kelly was attentive and kind.   Will be back for this exact meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bmCKWvCnBF9GGcwH40o4-g.text: Food and service on point ! I believe the gentlemen's name was Javier who helped us... great recommendations and outstanding customer service skills! On top of his game !!! Didnt have to ask for anything !!!! Went back a 2nd time and Christian helped us, same thing great recommendations got the chicken n waffles and it was good!

zeUyVC-lzv4u6DcL4frEIg.text: Metro Diner has become a staple of my weekly Friday ritual with my son. We found Metro Diner a couple months ago and after driving by several times visiting family on that side of town we decided to try it... NOT REGRETTED! Metro Diner has an atmosphere like any other, it has an at home family feel that you cannot find anywhere else in our valley. I have to admit I've not tried anything except for breakfast but I am guilty of not branching out! You cannot go wrong with the croissant French toast! Strawberry butter is Metro's sweet gift to the world and has quickly become a guilty pleasure of mine. Bring an appetite because the portions are massive. They always have a good variety of specials with a twist... flavored tea and coffee available.... they have an open kitchen so you can see exactly what is going on. Their are counter seats available if that's up to speed for you. Not personally my taste. now the service... our first time eating at the restaurant we were quickly greeted by the sweetest server, Allie! (Ally, Alley? Sorry) She is a ray of sunshine who helped us found exactly what we wanted. and each week will greet us even when she is not our server! Her sweet smile and spunky spirit kept us coming back every week........She is a highlight and has been on point with every visit. Each time we dine in, multiple servers will check in on us... manager visits to the table. This place has a great system. As long as the doors are open metro Diner will be a part of our week! Hard to find good breakfast and better yet, good hospitality! If you are reading this review, go to metro Diner!

cMSlVH8dSIRc-x4LxlnP8w.text: Great hospitality, amazing food. Everything is made fresh and in house, even the salad dressings. I had a grilled cheese with bacon and tomato on grilled sourdough. Best sandwich I've had in a long time. The peach iced tea is good too. Nice place to eat that's away from the strip, and very affordable. Highly recommended.

xVpsY3uIGQTlL0Jhlr6u-A.text: Definitely a breakfast of champs! Go hungry servings are big!  Very friendly staff with great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FZCMMMu-Gc9WRyDNBC680g.text: Loved all the food!!!!   Service was fantastic! Alejandro was amazing and made sure we got everything correct and in a timely manner! He also was so much fun!

adSzA7RNqVR-zdFbx7JBbA.text: First off I have to say that this place was packed. When I signed in I was told at least a 30 minute wait.  I was fine with that,  then the amazing hostess named Jhenell told me she is working on it. I watched her do her magic and she was getting everyone who was waiting seated within 10 minutes. She then told me and my party of 10 it will be in 2 minutes and she would have a table for us. She was True to her word. She is amazing and a valuable person in my book. The food was great and the service continued from start to finish was awesome.  I highly recommend this place

ZFliT2p5w596TB5sMCt-SQ.text: I'm so excited to write this review. I've been waiting months to try this place and it did not disappoint. First off, our waitress Madison was a delight. She was sweet, helped explain the menu and gave me the most amazing Bavarian chocolate coffee ever. We came Thursday at 10am, and were able to get a table right away. The timing of everything was great, from ordering to refills to food arriving. I got the San Francisco Benedict, hubby got the biscuit and gravy meal and we shared the cinnamon roll pancakes. My Benedict was cooked to perfection, right amount of golden liquid and perfectly poached eggs. The 5 star was def the hashbrowns. Most places hashbrowns are undercooked, but these bad boys had the best crispy exterior and perfectly cooked inside. The cinnamon roll pancakes were great and massive, it also came with warm syrup. Biscuits and gravy were solid, my homemade recipe is better but this is a close second. We will be back. And we are SO glad they dont have one in centennial because my hubs and I would be 500 lbs.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. San fran Benedict, cinnamon roll pancake, biscuit and gravy meal plus WARM Syrup!

9MRvoOycK_BeWPS6sBGjwA.text: Great atmosphere, good food and excellent service.   Good servings and the waffles are made perfectly.

MZRJVwW5IVjq19N_wyf-qg.text: Bomb.com. Dad complained so hard about how his meal was awful when he went so I just never had an inkling to ever go. Nor sure what happened to him but I had a fantastic experience. Got the chicken and waffles (of course) best damn chicken I've had outside of being cooked at a southern black family reunion. Put Soul Food Cafe to shame. They should be ashamed of themselves if a place called Metro Diner know how to get it harder than they do. Dont let the unassuming simple diner style fool you, they know how to wreck and I happily signed my check. I will definitely be returning.

av8dCvZuoQ00SSEhYct95A.text: We found Metro Diner on the TV Food maps APP and we like to try and visit places that Guy Fieri of Triple D has visited. Yelp reviews were good too! We went on a Sunday about 11:00 AM, there was a 25 minute wait for a party of 2. The hostess was super friendly and greeted  us immediately.  We waited about 15 minutes and she asked if we would like to sit at the counter as there were 2 seats available. We agreed and had a pleasant experience watching the cooks work very hard and quickly to serve the customers. Service was fast and efficient! I had the San Francisco Benedict and 1/2 waffle instead of hash browns. My husband had the breakfast sandwich! Everything was amazing! We will definitely go back for our next trip to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s2s-70_EZKcDX91DJ8eZlw.text: Thank you to our server Javier who helped us pick our breakfast this morning. My breakfast sandwich was amazing. Great customer service!

HVPki563HziuxVm7rs4l4g.text: This is our go-to breakfast spot in Vegas and we're here just about every weekend despite the fact that we live in CA. It's the hubb's favorite because 'they've perfected hash browns' (wth?!) - gotta love my simple guy but his take just doesn't do this place justice.  They've got unique menu options and specials that you just don't find at other places (check their menu out & you'll see what I mean), especially diners, and their portions are HUGE!    Their chicken & waffles is absolutely scrumptious!!! Not only is it too much to consume in a single sitting, more importantly, it surprisingly rivals Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles in So Cal (which is a favorite & must for me when in So Cal), but for different reasons. That homemade strawberry butter is HEAVEN on fluffy waffles; coupled with their unique mustard brined something or other juicy fried chicken - it's the perfect combo of sweet & salty but not too salty (yes mustard, which I avoid & was skeptical about - but it doesn't taste mustardy & gives it its own unique flavor).  And I didn't even add OR NEED TO add the sweet & spicy sauce that comes with it (I don't do condiments or spicy...I know I know, what a bland existence).  For a healthier option, their avocado toast is refreshing chunky avocado spread with fresh tomato quarters on multigrain toast - simple, light yet tasty as well as filling. It inspired me to make it at home, which for some reason is only a close second.  Or if you're lucky enough to order it & breakfast desert is your thing (like my son) - try the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes. Sweet mother of tastebuds!! Delicious & fluffy buttery pancake sweetness with crunchy caramel walnut overload!!  Everything sounds & looks good from their menu, I want to try to all but have so enjoyed what I've ordered in the past, it's hard not to order those items again.  Maybe one of these days we'll actually try their lunch or dinner options.  This place is popular & fills up fast but they're great about getting you seated & served quickly, and they have an outdoor patio with heaters as well. Service has always been excellent with the manager making his rounds just to check on you. Your server takes your order on an iPad & sends it right to the cook while standing in front of you - how's that for fast?  An when you're ready to pay, you do so with your server again through the iPad - super fast & convenient.  My not-so-perfect comments/observations:  1. Yes, the ladies bathroom is a bit messy (not gross or nasty though) more often than not; and  2. On my last visit I was seated facing the cooks. I couldn't help but notice & wonder why the cook wasn't wearing a hair net despite having a really great fro. I kept wondering if I should be checking my food for hair when I receive it (I have long curly hair & know for a fact curly hair falls out like you wouldn't believe). Note to manager: he's got a really great fro but please make him wear a hair net so I don't need to counsel myself. Thank you. Keep serving up deliciousness. That is all.

ytZ6kiku4r4ZvlwAXvIGNw.text: The BEST waiter in the world works here! His name is Alejandro. Oh, and the food is great too. We ordered avocado toast, San Francisco Benedict, Crab cake Benedict, and Reuben sandwich and chocolate chip pancakes for the kids. Enjoy!

5_gqOnUd3n9AIimNt1e1BQ.text: 2nd time coming to this restaurant for breakfast and again they always do it right!   I was watching a episode of masterchef and they made a Crab Benedict for Gordon. I never heard of this dish before so I had to find a place that made it in Las Vegas. When I did the search here on Yelp, I was so happy Meteo popped up! I had an excuse to come back.   Never had to wait for a seat and the server was so kind. I ordered the Crab Benedict with a side of Cheesy Grits. My husband ordered Biscuits and Gravy. Our food arrives and I notice I had ham on my muffin. I moved it to the side, because I thought that was a weird combination to put with Crab. Then I noticed no Crab.. She gave me the wrong Benedict.    We let her know and she was so apologetic about it and said another one will be out shortly. While I waited I just ate my husbands food lol. The gravy was soooo flavorful, you could drink it.   After mine arrived, I tore into it like a caveman. It was so delicious and I saved some for tomorrow morning. I love boxes lol.   Everything was great here and we are looking forward to a 3rd time.   FYI. I noticed you don't have crepes on the menu... I hope this can be changed in the future! Crepes are amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Benedict!

0L68077qYsBs7nmR42d7Dw.text: This place is so delicious and the service is fantastic. The chicken and waffles with strawberry butter is   Also the prices aren't bad for what you get.

y6BGM1cZol5IiVMVRhxOeA.text: Wow, wow, wow this is a great breakfast spot! First time here and we will definitely return. Great classic Eggs Benedict, great pancake breakfast and biscuits/gravy, great coffee and iced tea, great service!   What I liked best was the teamwork among the staff, everyone helping each other out. The kitchen staff got food out quick, lots of drink refills. And everything with a smile, even though the place was packed and busy.

-dykP-IMwezAHlJ1JWg3Sg.text: Metro is a solid diner- I pop in solo, snag a seat at the bar, and watch the cook make my food hot and fresh. The service puts this business above others in that they are attentive almost to a fault. My server will help me and nearly every other server who walks by will check my water, ask how I'm doing, or suggest dishes if I'm still looking at a menu. It's unreal, in a great way!  Always check the black board for specials- a recent crab cake benedict was bomb, but the stuffing waffle Thanksgiving special wsa most memorable. It's one of those places where you can't really go wrong. Somehow I haven't managed to try many of the dinner dishes, but I love that you can have meatloaf for breakfast or scrambled eggs for dinner, because it's all available all the time!

_8i5WBUhw9l1jqL5uFK0yg.text: Super delicious breakfast. We'll be back to try lunch! I think a lot of people just pass this place by as we did for months, but we're glad we gave it a try!  It gets pretty busy on weekend mornings. The food is really good, lots of choices on the menu, and the service was excellent.

J3Sw_BOPRP2fAhIF3HOZ-w.text: The food is good here and they give a big portion. The spicy chicken biscuit, chili, shrimp and grits, pancake everything is good here! You cant go wrong ordering anything at this restaurant. Not only is the food good but the server here is also very friendly and nice. Especially the manager or the owner he's very accommodating. We usually sit with our service dog in the patio. One weekend when we came to the patio it was completely full. He asked one of the table if they would like to move inside so we can sit in the patio with our service dog which they did willingly since they originally wanted a table inside anyway. They will go out of their way to try to accommodate their customers. Food is good service is great what more can you ask for?

rCH2grFrsVnIjNxbxlUIUw.text: Ok. Menu alone makes you want to return again and again! Any menu with chix and waffles, pot pie, meatloaf and ruebens is a winner in my book.  I had chix and waffles and wife had pot pie. They were both fantastic! Granted my chix and waffles was the sexier dish to look at, but the pot pie held her own....  We ordered a meatloaf to go so will provide updates.  The service was personal and attentive. Team effort with individualized care. Met the managing owner briefly and all employees were concerned in making our visit pleasant and delicious. Fully successful!  Jan J

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_waJ7XUq6sZJry5e3UWJtQ.text: The servers are SUPER nice, the service is REALLY fast, and the food is AMAZING. Been here several times now and always great. Couldn't recommend this place more highly. Only had breakfast though. Can't speak for the dinner food yet.

G35F-ySe520VJL7WCwHrSw.text: Been wanting to try this place since it's down the street from our house. Server (forget her name) was friendly, no major issues there.   I'm not a breakfast person, and the lunch and dinner items left very little for vegetarians. Basically, a grilled cheese or an avocado wrap. No option for a veggie patty or vegetable sandwich. I ordered the "avocado wrap" with the black beans on the side, with the side dish being "steamed vegetables". My guy ordered fried chicken and waffles.   The wrap came out mostly spinach, was missing the fried jalapenos, missing the chipotle ranch, and only had 2 small slices of avocado. Barely any cheese. The black beans that were originally supposed to go in the wrap, was brought to me in a 2 oz ramekin. I assumed the side of steamed vegetables would be an assortment of veggies, but was only zucchini and squash. They did taste good, just not what I expected. I asked our server about the missing ingredients in my wrap and she said she would get a manager. Took a while for said manager to come out. I didn't ask for her, the server just told her to come speak to us. Manager told me the wrap only comes with half an avocado for the entire thing (it's a sizable wrap), but she would put extra for me this time. Seriously? If the focus of the dish is avocado as advertised, there should be a decent amount. They must have really small avocados, based on what came out the first time. After some time, the manager brought me a new wrap (with double all the ingredients, which I didn't request, but was appreciated) and said my side of veggies would be out soon, but was forgotten. By this point, my guy was almost done eating so I had a few bites of the wrap and asked for a to go box. I gave up on getting the vegetables, which our server brought to me as she brought my to go box, because, according to her, she asked around who's veggies they were and no one claimed them so she figured out they were mine. I ended up taking home the majority of my food to eat at home. The wrap was good, but that was with extra ingredients requested by the manager. My guy said his food tasted good and was a large portion, but the chicken was more breading than meat. One star for a friendly server, the other star for the wrap tasting good, but only after doubling up on the ingredients. For my avocado wrap, his fried chicken and waffles, 2 ice waters and a glass of milk, $28.00. Likely, won't return.

enMfsnFIclnTd9Wzfg129w.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting Vegas for the week.  We decided we wanted to go on a little road trip so we went out in search of a 7-Eleven. We totally found metro diner on accident and it was one of the best food finds we had all week. It worked out because we didn't want to be stuck eating strip food or buffet. We went in for breakfast and had a basic eggs and hash browns breakfast with a side of biscuits and gravy because we never get that at home. We were so impressed with the food quality and customer service we decided to return every day for breakfast, trying something new each time.   On our second day of breakfast with some yo halla halla and croissant French toast we were even more impressed, our wonderful server told us that it was a chain and started in Jacksonville. Which made us super happy being from the east coast. After looking on the website we found a location an hour away from home ok the east coast.   This place had the best breakfast and customer service and we look forward to visiting the ones on the east coast!!!

4Zwg0rNhdszZqZfIB395fw.text: First time dining at this restaurant. Had a GREAT experience! Meatloaf was amazing! And our server, Alejandro was outstanding, very attentive and friendly.

hKBksWJNC8-LHeVvCphoMw.text: Yelp delivers. Big City burger was great! Wife had veggie wrap, said it was good as well.  Very prompt and friendly service.

vesx_ch7QNvfXeJtZVHWpQ.text: This place Delicious! There menu is 24 hours which is a plus in my book.  I had the Chicken Pot Pie on a Sunday, which I thoroughly enjoyed eating. The crust is thick and the broth is creamy. I was delighted to be having "lunch" for "breakfast".   The rest of Mi Familia ( My Family) ordered Biscuits and Gravy and also Huevos Rancheros.   We departed with a Chicken Pot Pie Togo and smiles on an early Sunday morning.

D7-8jgefU0gq2e-rbWrJrA.text: Saturday was my first visit to Metro Diner and I was very happy and please.  It was about 12 noon when we go there and it was very crowded, however we did not have to wait we where seated immediately, the host was very friendly.   When we sat down the waitress was right there ready to take our order.  The food came right out and was excellent!!!!!!  I had the Eggs, Bacon, hash browns, toast and grits.   Let me say everyone does not know how to cook grits these where like my mom made them.  Nice and thick with just the right butter and salt.  My son had the waffles and eggs and he was a happy camper.  My friend had the chicken and waffles!  MY God it was a side of chicken on the plate.  I will be back soon.......  Keep Up the good Work!!!

bg9X00Be7W7yIwUk4ji1Aw.text: This was the best breakfast we have had while visiting Vegas and best we've had in a long time.  The food was really really good, but Javier made it the best.  Our waiter was just fabulous.  I would be hard pressed to recall a time a waiter impressed us so.   I had the croissant French toast which was lovely.  I tasted my husband's biscuits and gravy which were seasoned perfectly and the biscuits were light and fluffy. Lots of sausage in the gravy too, not light on the meat.  My favorite thing was the home fries.  Javi explained that they use red potatoes and boil them and then do a quick deep fry.  They were perfection.     If you are hungry don't pass this place up!

SxmWaY2GbGWP3LGzd1BllQ.text: This was one of worst experiences at a restaurant. Me and my girlfriend shared the chicken and waffles plate and when it first arrived the plate was missing the chicken breast so the waiter said he would bring it separate when that piece finally arrived my girlfriend ate half of it and when I looked in the middle of the piece of chicken it was completely raw. Absolutely disgusting and there is no excuse for serving raw chicken to customers. I use to love this place but after that experience and how they treated the whole situation was unprofessional.

AKXW0ey-gGPVBEKvMr--xw.text: Awesomeness at it's finest, I'm on a strict diet, they have gluten free items, delicious food specials and so much more!!

vaBTu5hcDfTgeZLUQjRvlw.text: They have a great Monte Cristo sandwich. Yay. Good homestyle food., great customer service. John was our server and was great.

jtRxCYIMLAKXusKdM771Fw.text: This place is absolutely delicious! The waffles were made exactly how I wanted them and my eggs with hash browns were crispy perfection. The manager and our waiter were very attentive and understanding. My mom ordered the huevos rancheros but we are Mexican and are harsh critics on their American take on the eggs. Even so, we were more than willing to pay for our mistake, but the manager took care of it anyways! We even said that you dont go to a diner for Mexican breakfast, you go to Abuelita's for that. Will always be a customer of Metro Diner and leave happily full!

v-Z4P5QCX7ymEe15Lvo-0w.text: First and last for me. Ordered Spinach salad and it's really just spinach. The menu says Spinach salad comes with candied pecan, strawberry and blueberries and feta cheese and if I'm not mistaken, with bacon on top supposedly. All are missing except for the spinach! Good job Metro Diner!

uMnYRoVCvqmFoo_XGacYDg.text: Very good stuff and quite the variety. Fried chicken was very good not overly seasoned.   My only issue on a Saturday afternoon was the bathroom was a huge mess. Paper towels heaping over floor very.  Staff were excellent.  The wrapped silverware gave a sense of comfort.

ZSjEQv3T6iYVXnE2WdzZuQ.text: Sunday morning breakfast was awesome. Whether you're craving breakfast for dinner or dinner for breakfast they serve it all !! I had the bacon mushroom Swiss burger , which was cooked to perfection and full of flavor. My bf had the holy davoli burger which was 2 grilled cheeses stacked on top of each other with a burger patty and Cole slaw in the middle paired with Mac and cheese. Which by the way was deeeelicious!!! Autumn was our server and she was awesome even made our drinks to go when we were heading out. This is a Vegas go to spot !

K5dG8GBAAjNjNyzna9fU9A.text: I love this place. My personal favorite is the eggs Benedict. Everything has flavor and the atmosphere is very cozy, exactly what a diner should feel like imo. I go here often with my lady and we have never had a bad meal here. The service is always fast except when I'm super hungry ... then minutes seem like hours. But they always smile and are courteous, the drinks come quickly and the food shortly after. I recommend this place to my friends often.

toYuVOKui1HEskXNfUQpGg.text: Friendly and warm staff! Seat yourself dining. GREAT fried chicken. A True diner (breakfast, lunch and dinner menu available at all hours). Loved the classic, unpretentious casual environment especially on a lazy Sunday morning. Coffee is good. Just overall a really good comfort experience. Definite recommend.

3N8N6J7kiqQvP1QlpdouRA.text: First time checking this place out after a friend recommended this place. It's dubbed as the "place where locals eat"...I'm from LA and wish we had this gem back home. The people were friendly and very welcoming. Food was delicious. Luckily we had a big party so we all tried different plates. The Apple Yo Hala was super yummy and the egg dishes were also pretty tasty. Definitely will come back to this place when I'm back in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple Yo Hala French toast. So delicious!!

xMDJveEv58eD3SAvBWL6yA.text: Foood was delicious! Crab cake eggs Benedict was really good! Strawberry butter was BOMB! Employee was friendly

z3WGRncWuNbvhQY7LK9Apg.text: After a horrid experience at another breakfast place this morning, we still wanted to go out. We returned to Metro and had an awesome experience. Sat right away, and our server, Autumn, was at our table in seconds. Got my coffee right away (which is always good), and she even got, and laughed at, a corny pecan joke I made. Bonus! Got the food quickly, and thoroughly enjoyed the cinnamon roll pancakes. Always live coming here. More dishes to try in the future. Thanks for  saving a sinking morning.

OiS7l3-uMPeWhz6K10niFg.text: The best diner food I've ever had. Impeccable service. Chicken and waffles are amazing. Everything is made from scratch and you can tell.

-MRe-f2F8S0vo45wA01BfA.text: Such a laid back atmosphere, EXTREMELY friendly and helpful staff and the food?????? One word...YUMMY!

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Chicken &amp; Waffles with strawberry butter...SO GOOD!!!

BNTbqjT6thxki5B-B2EUPw.text: Wen't and took my Mom as a treat for being my mom.. Sunday at 1 pm and the place was packed, we didn't have to wait too long before we were seated, and luckily we got a booth. I ordered the meatloaf which comes with mashed potatoes and gravy, and a side of grilled veggies (really good!). I couldn't believe my mom just ordered a Belgium waffle, she has been begging me to take her here for weeks, and now that they are open she orders something I can make at home. She said it was really good, she said the meatloaf was good, but she can make better... haha that's my mom for ya. She got a peach cobbler to go and said it would take a week to finish it, she polished that sucker off in two days.  The pricing is bit high but the food is really good.

hkyxfYRAsdJQLcOwx4abrg.text: Your crazy if you haven't gone here!  Service is fantastic and food phenomenal!  Breakfast foods are insane. Burgers and chicken...their fried chicken. Try those chicken and waffles!

6BdThbLPIVXKWqxCV3_JFg.text: I've eaten here half a dozen times so far, and every item that I've had here has been excellent, and the staff is super courteous.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yo Hala on the Square

glZQ5bFCX31jDVdNXUv4VQ.text: We found this diner using yelp and came based on yelp reviews. We are so glad we did!!!! The service and food was fantastic. We came in for a late brunch before heading back to California( where we're from). I got the Bissell Breakfast and boy was the amount I got filling. It is a traditional 2 eggs breakfast that I got with bacon, hash browns , sourdough toast and pancakes. Sooooo fulllll.  My husband got the Monte Cristo which almost made me regret getting a traditional breakfast. I got to take a bite and omg, we now know where to come to get a amazing Monte Cristo when visiting Vegas. We WILL return next time we are visiting Vegas and travel away from the stop just for this place. Our server, Kelly R, was wonderful and attentive. While most of our interactions were with her, the rest of the staff also seems really nice as well. We would absolutely recommend this to anyone who is looking for a delicious diner a little ways off strip. It is worth the trip!!!!

Imbsahp4L7JCbOAAjDKRcA.text: The best part about Metro Diner is they make you feel like you're part of the family.  It's my home away from home!

BnzQQAKWXocIMhZrQ44ozA.text: Breakfast was really good. Great place, atmosphere, awesome service, and most importantly, good food!

xbygkRDTnTwIZ3sTRyNRIA.text: First time here and will definitely be back! Our family had the chicken parmesan, braised beef tips and 2 egg breakfast . Huge portions! You won't leave hungry!  Attentive and friendly staff!  Nice atmosphere. We had the apple cobbler for dessert and that was a huge portion as well and very tasty! I highly recommend this place!

yrGpR592ccSIBQ3LRN2ByQ.text: Fast and friendly service! Our server was very nice and helpful.  They didn't have chicken fried steak on the menu but our server let us order it anyway, I ended up getting the chicken and waffles. Both dishes were very good. I liked how our server told me how to mix the syrup and hot sauce perfect combo.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1F6xkTEfMT9lEZCT27OiDw.text: I have been to the location on Tropicana, and absolutely loved it there, but after moving from the area, we didn't really get the chance to visit anymore. The other night, we decided we wanted to return, and realized with a start that the other location had moved! We let our heart rates return to normal after realizing they had simply moved rather than shut down, and decided to pay the new location a visit. We were absolutely not disappointed, as everything was just as great as I remembered. Our server was John, and from the beginning he was funny, personable, and attentive. I would return just because of him, even if the food hadn't been top notch, (which it was, no worries there). I can't wait for payday so we can visit again!

FDhLVP5B2iWNGeoGygt6UA.text: The family and myself went for an early dinner on a Friday. There was about a 10-20 minute wait. We got sat pretty much after about 10 minutes. The food is good and taste great. Don't be fooled by the plate size. I tried the meatloaf and it didn't look it was going to fill me up but it did. The gravy is good and the vegetables were amazing!... the tables are a bit small if you have a big group or kids in high chairs (we had 2). The service isn't bad but I'm giving it a 4 instead of a 5 cause I believe the prices are a little high for what you get.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3njoz_N3CLGPkCbhqSVe9Q.text: So at breakfast/diner type places, I always have trouble deciding between the biscuits and gravy and the eggs benedict because I love both (What can I say? I love saucy eats!). When I mentioned this to the super helpful and friendly server, he said that there was an item not on the menu that combined both. It's called the southwest benedict and it is biscuits and gravy with sausage patties and a poached egg on top. It was exactly what I wanted and it combined the best of both worlds. The biscuits are made in house and they aren't anything to write home about, but they were decent. The sausage gravy was delicious, the eggs were perfectly poached, and the sausage patty went perfectly with everything else. In some ways, it's like a fancy breakfast sandwich (think sausage and egg biscuit sandwich with gravy on top), which made me very happy. There's also something called home fries, which is cut up red potatoes parboiled and then deep fried. They were simple, but oh so delicious. It didn't have any special seasoning (maybe a bit of salt?), but maybe it's because they make them there, it was really good. Overall, it was a lovely meal, and if I want a good breakfast for a decent price (not Las Vegas strip prices), I will come back here.

e1qWmj432FitXZ8jI0e6wA.text: Excellent biscuits and gravy he and sweet tea service was terrific atmosphere terrific

0O0atkwRu9CiksnSH3OB6A.text: Normally I really love this place. I've been coming since they opened this location. But today, today I'm beyond disappointed. It started with whomever answered the phone, they hung up on me, when I called back and informed him I needed to place an order and he had just hung up on me he was not apologetic at all just put me on hold and someone else got on the phone. Fast forward to picking up my order, the host was welcoming and kind but the lady that brought my order did not give me a receipt AND she short changed me. When I noticed I was missing change the host went to tell the other lady then came back with a dollar. Being the honest person I am I explained that was more than I was owed, I paid $40 my total was $34 plus change (I don't know bc I wasn't given a receipt) and she gave me just $5 back, so I should have some coins not all dollar bills. I asked if they were going to do things the correct way and the girl that brought my order says "they don't keep loose change" funny considering it's a place of business you should always make sure you have exact change. It really baffles me how they tried to shortchange me without explanation. I've never had this issue before and I hope not to have it again.  *UPDATE: got home and my food was a MESS. There was gravy dripping from the side of the container, the bag and other container were covered in gravy. I got a partial biscuit (part of the top was missing) and it was soggy from being thrown on top of the veggies and gravy. EXTREMELY disappointed and I WILL NOT be returning to what used to be my favorite cheat meal.

-EvMVx6QudASoWFnfMSM5w.text: I was torn between the highly regarded biscuit and gravy dish and a bacon, egg and cheese croissant so I ordered both. The biscuits and gravy were okay...ginormous, but did not have that buttermilk, southern-style taste I was looking for. Also, I did not like that they were drenched in gravy and sitting in a massive pool of it. Why not drizzle some gravy on the biscuits and then put some on the side to enable the customer to add more if they want to? I returned the dish to the waitress. As for the croissant sandwich, if it wasn't for the bacon, it would've been bland as hell. I expected them to butter and lightly fry each side of the croissant prior to assembling the sandwich to add buttery cheesy goodness, but they did not do that which made it a below average experience. Strike 3 was dessert. I ordered the peach cobbler and received a extremely sweet peach crumble/crisp as big as my face. Although the service extended was good, with disappointment on top of disappointment, I couldn't wait to leave. I won't be returning however if you want to try this place and you're particular about your food like I am, let them know how you want your dishes prepared in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach cobbler with a dollop of vanilla ice cream which was more of a peach crisp/crumb
Photo of Metro Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, egg and cheese croissant

A3DjsDLLo96k-TGAIJ6MXw.text: What's not to like?  Waffles  Strawberry butter Hash browns French vanilla coffee Chicken, Incredible The staff's humor & customer service is one of the reasons I will keep on coming back.

ZwEEt0GmvNh3bixovjeL5Q.text: First time here. Will definitely be back. Everyone was beyond friendly and smiling, even the guests. Monique was wonderful. Seriously, it's very hard to find good service here in Vegas, but this place is spot on. Even the manager came over and checked in. We sat outside on the patio. The food came out in literally like 6 minutes it was crazy fast. Plus it was absolutely fantastic. I was actually disappointed that I couldn't finish it all! I ordered the Avocado Toast (add spinach), 2 over medium eggs and crispy hash browns and my brother ordered the Big Mikes BLT (I think that's what it was called) and it was humongous! All around 5 stars.

hjJSswCBOFaqAnN7BOAwkQ.text: I live very close to this place and finally tried it for breakfast. Very good! We had the chicken and waffles as well as the biscuits and gravy. Both were great! The chicken and waffles were better than any I've ever had in New Orleans. Must try!
